par.text: Osmium is a greyish-blue, hard and brittle heavy metal. It exhibits low reactivity, dissolves only in aqua regia (a mixture of 3 parts of concentrated hydrochloric acid and 1 part of concentrated nitric acid by volume). At elevated temperatures powdered osmium reacts with oxygen, producing the highly poisonous osmium(VIII) oxide – Os

, a substance of unpleasant odour. At elevated temperatures osmium reacts also with fluorine, chlorine, sulphur and phosphorus. Osmium was discovered in 1803 by the English chemist Smithson Tennant. Its name is derived from the Greek word
